metadata.title: CVE-2018-1058 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way Postgresql allowed a user to modify thebehavior of a query for other users. An attacker with a user account coulduse this flaw to execute code with the permissions of superuser in thedatabase. Versions 9.3 through 10 are affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1058` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
libecpg6 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
libpq5 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.22-0ubuntu0.14.04').
postgresql-9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
